content: In 1924, which 'Great Gatsby' author was said to have been heavily in debt due to his extravagant lifestyle?

F. Scott Fitzgerald, the author of "The Great Gatsby," was indeed known for his lavish lifestyle and financial troubles. In 1924, when he was writing "The Great Gatsby," Fitzgerald was deeply in debt due to his extravagant spending habits. He had a penchant for luxury and often lived beyond his means, which led to significant financial difficulties throughout his life.
